action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley (for himself, Mr. Rahall, Mrs. Capito, Mr. Barr, Mr. Murphy of Pennsylvania, Mr. Doyle, Mr. Enyart, and Mr. Cramer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To authorize appropriations for fossil energy research and development programs at the Department of Energy, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Fossil Energy Encouragement and Accountability Act of 2014
.

paragraph.text: the United States depends on fossil resources for over 80 percent of its energy needs;

these advanced technologies will support new power platforms of the future that will be highly efficient, including technologies such as ultra supercritical materials production, advanced gas turbines, gasification platforms that can also enable the expansion of domestic fuels, the liquids and chemical industry, and advanced energy platforms including pressured oxycoal combustion and chemical looping; and

it is important that the Department of Energy continue to develop these technologies and have sufficient funds to ensure that a diverse portfolio of options are available to ensure that the United States can compete in a clean energy future, one which will include significant fossil fuel resources.

section.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary of Energy for fiscal year 2015 for fossil energy research and development $734,000,000 , of which—

paragraph.text: $435,000,000 shall be for coal research and development;
$100,000,000 shall be for natural gas and oil research and development;
$17,000,000 shall be for plant and capital equipment; and

section.text: None of the funds authorized by section 2 may be used to—

paragraph.text: consolidate or close any element of the National Energy Technology Laboratory; or
transfer National Energy Technology Laboratory human resources functions from any laboratory.
